page.title: 10Green Belt Festival
page.content: Up until 1984 the famous Green Belt Festival was held in the field adjacent to Odell Great Wood. Thiswas an annual event that lasted over the Bank Holiday Weekend.It was a Christian Festival with a difference. It is open for all ages, but mainly tended to attract the young teenage people. Readings and songs of a religous nature took place, but with a young flavour. The instruments used to accompany the singing were guitars and drums, which are more readily linked with rock and roll, than hymn singing. People going to the festival camped over the holiday and used to bring great activity to an area that is not inhabited by many people. One year Cliff Richard was at the Festival. The celebration has now grown so large in popularity that it has moved to a larger site in Northamptonshire.
